document_data.name: The Six Shields
document_data.mainbody: '''The Six Shields''' was a rough and dirty rooming house located in [[Ashabenford]] in the late 1300s [[DR]].{{Cite interactive atlas|3800 Ashabenford}} It provided housing and food for the field hands, drovers, or other laborers of [[Mistledale]], but did not discriminate against those who simply could not afford the [[Ashabenford Arms]] or [[White Hart Inn]].
document_data.Location: It was located east, also downwind, of [[Lhuin's tannery]] within the town. Most of the tenants would spend evenings on the porch; this was rather ironic given the malodorous scents wafting down from the tannery.
document_data.Cost: A bed for a night cost 1 [[cp]], or 6 [[sp]] for a tenday; the latter included use of the stables and two daily meals of milk, cheese, and hard bread.
